summary: This is a court subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Palm Beach Police Department, commanding them to appear and produce all records relating to Ghislaine Maxwell and/or Jeffrey Epstein for the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The subpoena is dated October 7, 2021, and requires appearance on November 29, 2021.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, which is the subject of the subpoena. The subpoena demands records relating to her.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named alongside Ghislaine Maxwell as a subject for which the Palm Beach Police Department must produce all records.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signed the subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: Both are named together as subjects for which law enforcement records are being subpoenaed, indicating their legal and investigative connection in the case.
As the U.S. Attorney, Strauss is issuing a subpoena on behalf of the prosecution in the criminal case against Maxwell.

events.title: Subpoena Appearance Date
events.description: The date the Palm Beach Police Department is commanded to appear in court to testify and produce records related to Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Subpoena Issuance
events.description: The date the subpoena was issued and signed by U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss.

locations: 40 Foley Square, Courtroom 906, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Palm Beach (implied location of the Police Department)
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office subpoenaed the Palm Beach Police Department for all records related to Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein.
The subpoena is part of the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
Failure to comply with the subpoena would constitute contempt of court.
The subpoena indicates ongoing investigative or pre-trial evidence gathering in late 2021 for Maxwell's trial.
